executive_summary: Growth for drywall and insulation installers has been sluggish over the current period because of a slowdown in commercial building construction and interest rate hikes slowing residential construction late in the current period. Overall, industry-wide revenue has dipped at a CAGR of 0.0% over the past five years and is expected to total $57.2 billion in 2023, when revenue will drop by an estimated 2.0%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Declining Business Sentiment Hindered the Commercial Real Estate Landscape
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Despite low interest rates set by the Federal Reserve, declining macroeconomic conditions prevented business expansion. Remote work continued through the height of COVID-19, reducing downstream markets' need for commercial space and drywall and insulation installers. Interest rate hikes and the threat of a recession have severely reduced the value of nonresidential construction and hampered commercial construction as business sentiment remains low.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Contractors Have Faced Volatility in the Residential Market
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The residential housing market accounts for a significant portion of revenue. Low interest rates and improved access to credit spurred consumer mortgage originations before 2022, increasing new home construction and improvements. The construction of major apartment buildings and condominiums requiring proper drywall and insulation services to accommodate these large-scale operations benefitted contractors through 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Government Incentives and New Technology Aided Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Government incentives designed to enhance energy efficiency in homes have stimulated demand for drywall and insulation services. The innovation of energy-efficient insulation products will continue as state and local governments offer more financial incentives for homeowners. Technological innovations have enabled drywall and insulation installers to charge more for increasingly complex projects.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: CONSTRUCTION WAS DEEMED AN ESSENTIAL BUSINESS AMID COVID-19
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The United States' consistent need for more efficient and cleaner infrastructure since the entire economy constantly expands alongside population growth fuels the need for drywall and insulation installers. The government's determination to classify drywall and insulation installers as an essential business amid COVID-19 displays how crucial these services are to economic growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE RESIDENTIAL MARKET WILL SPUR GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Since home building and renovation projects take a relatively short time to complete, the level of activity within the residential building market is highly susceptible to the price of financing.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: G R O W I N G  C O R P O R A T E  P R O F I T  W I L L  B O O S T  C O M M E R C I A L  B U I L D I N G
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Strong consumer spending allows corporate profit to increase. Even with economic uncertainties, larger businesses can afford higher associated costs.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: I N S T A L L E R S  T O  C O N T I N U E  F A C I N G  S U P P L Y  C H A I N - I N D U C E D  H E A D W I N D S
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: COVID-19 outbreaks and the continued conflict in Ukraine will cause supply chain disruptions.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: COMPETITION WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE OVER THE NEXT FIVE YEARS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The growing presence of franchised operations will continue placing competitive pressures on standalone establishments and independent contractors.

industry_definition: Companies in the Drywall Insulation Installers industry primarily engage in drywall, plasterwork and building insulation work.
key_trends: Low interest rates spurred construction activity, leading to a need for increased installation services.
Nonresidential construction markets returning to growth will be a boon.
Consumers and businesses took advantage of low interest rates, boosting drywall and insulation installation.
Government tax credits for energy-efficient upgrades have ended.
Insulation contracting surged with renovations and new home builds.
Advances in energy efficiency for drywall and insulation encourage renovation while minimizing costs for installers.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The commercial market includes office, retail, lodging and amusement park developments.
Residential building construction includes the installation of drywall in single-family houses, apartment buildings, duplexes and other attached residential buildings.

Municipal building construction includes drywall and insulation services for public schools, libraries, government offices, prisons, police stations, fire stations and other public recreational areas.
The industrial segment includes manufacturing facilities, assembly plants, mills and warehouses.

products_and_services.product_description: Drywall contracting involves erecting drywall gypsum sheeting or using lath and plaster as interior cladding on houses.
Contractors install insulation materials in all types of new construction.
The popularity of gypsum drywall shrinks lath and plaster usage.
Applying acoustical insulation occurs principally on industrial and commercial premises.

tier_1_suppliers: Drywall & Insulation Installers in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Roofing, Siding & Insulation Wholesaling in the US
Manufactured Home Wholesaling in the US
Heavy Equipment Rental in the US
tier_1_buyers: Gypsum Product Manufacturing in the US
Finance and Insurance in the US
Commercial Building Construction in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Return of Live Performances Has Benefitted Acoustical Contracting
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The return of in-person musical performances following the outbreak of COVID-19 has offset lackluster industrial and commercial construction activity.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Increased Consumer Housing Spurred Insulation Contracting
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumers took advantage of low-interest rates by building new homes or renovating existing ones.
Stucco involves the application of Portland cement plaster or other similar compounds to the exterior of a building.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Inflation Reduction Act to Spur Growth for Synthetic Stucco
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Tax incentives in the Inflation Reduction Act to construct energy-efficient buildings will spur growth for synthetic stucco.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Rising Interest Rates Hiked Expenditure on Miscellaneous Contracting Activities
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Interest rate hikes have made new construction more expensive.

business_locations.location_description: Structures located in the Mid-Atlantic region are larger relative to those in the rest of the United States.
The Southeast region is known for its extreme heat and humidity, requiring insulation to live comfortably.
Housing activity in the West has ramped up in connection with low interest rate offerings.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Federal regulation sets new compliance standards to limit the elemental sulfur content in drywall.
The US Occupational Safety and Health Administration requires workers to don protective clothing on-site.
This requires contractors to provide clients with details of the insulation installed.
To prevent the spread of COVID-19, workers must adhere to federal and local health and safety requirements.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is in the decline stage.
The competition level is high and steady.

basis_points.basis_description: Internal competition is stiff among contractors.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Local or Regional Sphere of Influence
concentration_points.concentration_description: Most drywall and insulation installers are small companies operating locally.
Since most drywall and insulation contractors work out of one establishment and have low employment counts.
The handful of larger drywall and insulation contractors operate within other industries.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages Costs Have Dipped as Business Has Slowed
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Drywall contractors typically employ on a per-project basis.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs Have Fallen Despite Supply Chain Woes
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The rising popularity of gypsum drywall has also cut down purchase costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Installers rely on high-skilled physical labor
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Installers rely on high-skilled physical labor to complete quality jobs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patent technologies
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low.
The concentration of technologies is high in this industry.

volatility_points.volatility_title: NONCYCLICAL MAINTENANCE REDUCES VOLATILITY FOR CONTRACTORS
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for repair work steadies' revenue flow during periods of depressed construction activity.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Consumer Perception Can Cause Large Swings
volatility_points.volatility_description: Downstream residential construction activity greatly impacts revenue volatility.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Return of live performances has benefitted acoustical contracting
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Applying acoustical insulation occurs principally on industrial and commercial premises.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Increased consumer housing spurred insulation contracting
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Contractors install insulation materials in all types of new construction.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The popularity of gypsum drywall shrinks lath and plaster usage

FAQs.question: Does your company serve as a general contractor or third-party subcontractor on most projects?
FAQs.answer: Drywall and insulation installers mostly serve as third-party contractors.

FAQs.question: Are you solely focused on new work, or do you participate in remodeling activities?
FAQs.answer: Remodeling plays a much larger role in this industry than most.

FAQs.question: Does your company typically rent or own equipment for projects?
FAQs.answer: Most equipment in the industry is owned.

FAQs.question: Does your company make use of subcontractors to save on wage costs?
FAQs.answer: Wage costs account for 32.7% of total revenue.
